hypothesis_content.title: Futures Funding Rate Divergence Signals Liquidity Imbalance Reversal
hypothesis_content.statement: When perpetual futures aggregate funding rates are strongly positive (>+0.01% per 8hr) but spot price is failing to make new highs (lower highs on 4H chart) over 48 hours in a NEUTRAL/BULL regime, it indicates a long liquidity trap. A swift, sharp downside liquidation flush will occur within 48 hours to reset leverage.
hypothesis_content.rationale: High positive funding with price stagnation suggests over-leveraged longs paying to hold positions without upward momentum. This is structurally unstable. A minor catalyst or failed breakout can trigger cascading long liquidations, providing a high-probability, short-duration short opportunity.
entry_conditions: Aggregate top-5 crypto perpetual funding rate > +0.01%
BTC spot price forms a lower high on the 4-hour chart over the last 48 hours
BTC open interest is at a 7-day high
Market regime is NEUTRAL or BULL (confidence > 55%)
4-hour Taker Buy/Sell Ratio < 0.95 for latest candle

exit_conditions.take_profit: Aggregate funding rate resets to < +0.005% OR a 2% price drop from entry occurs
exit_conditions.stop_loss: BTC price makes a new 48-hour high

hypothesis_content.falsification_criteria: If price breaks upward despite the funding imbalance, sustaining highs without a liquidation flush, invalidating the 'trap' premise.
